page.title: 10 A Deputy's job at Whitemoor
page.content: The job of an underground official commonly known as a deputy, is to supervise the safe working of all the workmen in his section. There are 21 shifts a month, each consisting of 7 1/4 hours, including an overtime shift which has to be worked as part of the contract of employment. The deputy liked having something different to do each day, as no two days were the same because of the conditions. He liked the responibility which went with his job but disliked the enviroment. He had been working at Whitemoor for 6 years and explained that the underground roadways were wider and the technology much more sophisticated than at his previous pit. The deputy said that most accidents are caused through neglect of the person involved to adhere to the safety rules.
